title: @Riot: Make Veigars Ultimate Projectile Size scale with AP
body:
Honestly i love Deleting people with {{champion:45}} but it looks like such a tiny particle unless you use Final Boss Veigar. 

So make it so his Primordial Burst scales size with AP

so like, 45  Units larger per 100 AP. It's only Visual, but still, as a magekiller shouldn't his Ult look larger as he scales his AP, showing the fear he instills on AP Mid Laners everywhere?

replies.body: Seems like a solid idea to me. We'll throw that into some playtests, see if it feels right in game. That'll likely involve a smaller than current missile at zero AP, same size as current at moderate amounts of AP and bigger than current above that.

Also any further plans for Veigar? I absolutely loved the gameplay rework (even picked up Final Boss!) but his ult is a little boring still and lacks gameplay imo. Not saying to make it a skillshot or anything, I just think it could use more flavor than 'nukes super hard, especially against AP'. Like maybe have the AP portion damage as an AoE blast with the visuals getting bigger the more AP the target has (have to choose between hyper-nuking the ADC or dealing strong damage to the entire enemy team by hitting the enemy AP). It's just that for an ultimate it's pretty 2-dimensional imo and it'd be cool for it to feel more meaningful than just a hyper-nuke.

He already can easily hit a point where he can one shot any carry off the map with just his ult reliably, and with D-cap buffs, and stronger penetration items he can access, as well as higher AP in general... Monster mode engaged soon(TM).

Changes relevant to Viegar in the new patch....

1.  Dcap goes up 200 gold in price, but gets a 5% increase on passive to 35%.  Increases AP gained from Raba passive on his Q alone anywhere from 10-20 AP, on top of increase overall on lategame rabadons.

2.  Liandry's buff to 80 AP, giving him even more raw Mpen he can get in his build, as well as tank "poking/busting" power.

3.  Luden's changed to have lower AP slightly, but more MS and less cost.   Overall a buff on Veigar.  Same case for Zhonyas.

4.  Seraphs changed to a NLR item, meaning even more reason to build a tear on Viegar, as it will grant more AP upon being finished.

5.  RoA is changed to a 100 AP item at max stacks, plus more Mana too, if you go a tear route.  You will not run out of mana now.

Effectively, Viegar is no longer locked into his old build, and can now have a LOT of options on what he gets.   He can easily get tear for a ton of raw AP later on (New seraphs can hit 140 AP on just itself+base mana pool), or can grab a "kiting ~~tank~~**ALL**buster" build of Liandrys Rylias Rabadon Void that still leaves him with the same AP of getting a "damage" build.
